intro: Allium trachycoleum, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a short, sturdy stem and produces spherical seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in native plant ecosystems.
